page.title: 09Transport
page.content: In{Blackmore}there are various forms of{transport}but the most popular way of getting around is by car.The majority in{Blackmore Parish}have two cars but some people have more.A bus service ran through{Blackmore}as early as 1926.It went from{Ongar}to Brentwood.The bus was privately owned and had solid tyres.The{Eastern {National}buses go through{Blackmore from{Brentwood}and{Chelmsford}hourly and from{Ongar}4 hourly.The{Mini-bus in{Blackmore}was brought in 1984 it cost Â£8600 plus insurance.They raised Â£6300 then the{Parish Council}granted them Â£2500.The idea of getting the {Mini-bus}was thought of by the warden of the Community centre so that the villagers had transport available.the {Mini-bus}does 25-30 miles to the gallon ,it is limited to 50 mile per hour by law and carries 15 people.
